pageContext.claim: “We lost 60,000 factories and plants [because of NAFTA].”
pageContext.analysis: Trump was referring to the North American Free Trade Agreement but he is likely referring to the number of U.S. factory closures and job losses since China joined the World Trade Organization in 2001, a talking point he often uses. The number for factory closures is accurate, but to suggest China was the only factor is misleading. Economists say automation and other forces also played a role. The number for job losses is seriously exaggerated. Official government data show 4.3 million to 4.7 million U.S. manufacturing jobs were lost after China joined the WTO -- but, again, although China had a big role, it's misleading to blame it all on them. And he certainly cannot use this number when referring to NAFTA.
